vehicles.description: A black vehicle is parked on the right side of the road, partially blocking the lane.
vehicles.explanation: This vehicle may pose a danger, as it reduces the width of the lane, requiring other vehicles to detour.

vehicles.description: A silver car stopped on the right, positioned in front of the SUV.
vehicles.explanation: If this car needs to go around the parked SUV, then it may cause an obstruction.

vehicles.description: A dark-colored car is stopped at the center of the intersection ahead, its body tilted slightly to the left, making the driver's side visible.
vehicles.explanation: This vehicle appears to be preparing to turn left or is waiting to turn left. Its position and orientation indicate that it is part of the traffic flow and may affect the ability of this car to proceed.

vulnerable_road_users.description: A pedestrian wearing a green top is crossing the street with a package, instead of using the designated crosswalk.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Pedestrians are the primary focus, as they are directly in the path of autonomous vehicles and have the right of way, necessitating immediate action to ensure their safety.

vulnerable_road_users.description: There is another pedestrian on the left side ahead, walking in the same direction along the road.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Although it is not a pressing concern, it is necessary to pay attention to these pedestrians to prevent them from crossing the street or affecting traffic flow.

vulnerable_road_users.description: A delivery worker riding a two-wheeled vehicle is traveling in the same direction as a car, located between a parked silver vehicle and the lane.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Bicycles situated between the driving lane and parked cars may lead to unpredictable movements, such as merging into the traffic lane; autonomous vehicles should be prepared for this.

traffic signs.description: The yield sign on the right side of the road indicates that you need to give way to oncoming traffic or other road users.
traffic signs.explanation: The meaning of this sign is very important as it indicates a potential merge or intersection, requiring self-driving vehicles to be prepared to yield.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the traffic image, several road users are present across multiple categories.

Among the vehicles, there is a black vehicle parked on the right side of the road, partially blocking the lane, which may pose a danger by reducing the lane width and requiring other vehicles to detour. A silver car is stopped on the right, in front of the SUV, and if it needs to go around the parked SUV, it may cause an obstruction. Additionally, there is a dark-colored car stopped at the center of the intersection ahead, slightly tilted to the left, indicating it may be preparing to turn left or is waiting to turn. Its position and orientation suggest it is part of the traffic flow and could impact the ability to proceed.

Regarding vulnerable road users, a pedestrian wearing a green top is crossing the street with a package but not using the designated crosswalk, necessitating immediate action to ensure their safety. Another pedestrian is walking along the left side of the road in the same direction, which, though not a pressing concern, requires attention to prevent them from crossing the street or affecting traffic flow. Furthermore, a delivery worker on a two-wheeled vehicle is traveling in the same direction as the car, located between a parked silver vehicle and the lane, and may exhibit unpredictable movements such as merging into the traffic lane.

A yield sign is also present on the right side of the road, indicating the need to give way to oncoming traffic or other road users. This sign is crucial for indicating a potential merge or intersection, requiring self-driving vehicles to be prepared to yield.

driving_suggestion: Slow down and prepare to stop for pedestrians crossing the road. Pay attention to yield signs. Monitor parked vehicles and pedestrians at the roadside for any behavioral changes that could affect traffic flow. Maintain a safe distance from the vehicle in front. Your own vehicle should also be attentive to parked vehicles along the side of the road, making slight steering adjustments or changing lanes if necessary, while cautiously managing oncoming traffic at intersections. As you approach an intersection, drive cautiously and be prepared to yield to oncoming vehicles that are stopped at the intersection and pedestrians that are crossing. Moreover, keep a safe distance from delivery workers and be alert for any sudden movements from them or the parked silver car.

1.description and explanation: A triangular road sign indicating 'Yield' which requires drivers to slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary to let other road users go first.
